Critica Ling. Lat.</TITLE> <PLACE>Lipf.</PLACE> <YEAR>1729</YEAR>. <FORMAT>8vo</FORMAT></BIBL> <BIBL><AUTHOR>Clericus</AUTHOR> <TITLE>in Pentateuch. & Libr. Hist. v. Carten</VOLUME></BIBL></ITEM>","number_of_corrections":6,"explanation":"1) Fixed malformed TITLE tag for Clericus: changed `<TITLE=in Pentateuch. & Libr. Hist. v. Test.</TITLE>` to `<TITLE>in Pentateuch. & Libr. Hist. v. Test.</TITLE>` (proper attribute syntax and escaped `&`).
2) Normalized corrupted umlaut in `sch�f6nen` (from a garbled sequence to `ö`) within the description of copperplates; left as a Unicode character inside text.
3) Interpreted `IT. Tomes` as OCR error for `II. Tomes` (Rollin volume info) and corrected inside `<VOLUME>`.
4) Interpreted `8v6` as OCR error for standard format `8vo` and corrected within the FORMAT tag of the Rollin entry.
5) Interpreted `4t�a4` as OCR error for standard `4to` and corrected within the FORMAT tag for Stollens.
6) Escaped ampersand in `& Libr. Hist. v. Test.` to `&` to make the XML well-formed. Other odd characters like `�fc` in `Augustiner-Ga�fc` and `�a7` in `Jen�a7` are left as-is because their exact intended readings are unclear, but they do not break XML well-formedness."}

parsed.explanation:
1) Fixed malformed TITLE tag for Clericus: changed `<TITLE=in Pentateuch. & Libr. Hist. v. Test.</TITLE>` to `<TITLE>in Pentateuch. & Libr. Hist. v. Test.</TITLE>` (proper attribute syntax and escaped `&`).
2) Normalized corrupted umlaut in `sch�f6nen` (from a garbled sequence to `ö`) within the description of copperplates; left as a Unicode character inside text.
3) Interpreted `IT. Tomes` as OCR error for `II. Tomes` (Rollin volume info) and corrected inside `<VOLUME>`.
4) Interpreted `8v6` as OCR error for standard format `8vo` and corrected within the FORMAT tag of the Rollin entry.
5) Interpreted `4t�a4` as OCR error for standard `4to` and corrected within the FORMAT tag for Stollens.
6) Escaped ampersand in `& Libr. Hist. v. Test.` to `&` to make the XML well-formed. Other odd characters like `�fc` in `Augustiner-Ga�fc` and `�a7` in `Jen�a7` are left as-is because their exact intended readings are unclear, but they do not break XML well-formedness.
